Question: How do I turn on a desktop computer?

To turn on a desktop computer, you simply need to press the power button on the computer case. This button is usually located on the front or top of the case and is labeled with a power symbol. Pressing this button sends a signal to the power supply unit (PSU) to start supplying power to the motherboard, which then boots up the computer. It is important to note that you should never attempt to turn on a computer by inserting a screwdriver into an electrical socket or connecting two metal pins on the motherboard with a screwdriver, as this can cause serious damage to the computer and pose a risk of electric shock.
